body_html:
Seems reasonable to me. The assertion as-is is quite strict.

If it's part of the public API, I'd be worried about returning random proto nonsense for things in the checkpoint that didn't get loaded. But maybe something like variables_not_restored for Python variable objects which don't have a checkpointed value? It's still slightly odd, since the collection will grow over time as graph building (or eager execution) progresses and variables get created. But seems useful enough.

body:
Seems reasonable to me. The assertion as-is is quite strict.

If it's part of the public API, I'd be worried about returning random proto nonsense for things in the checkpoint that didn't get loaded. But maybe something like `variables_not_restored` for Python variable objects which don't have a checkpointed value? It's still slightly odd, since the collection will grow over time as graph building (or eager execution) progresses and variables get created. But seems useful enough.
